greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers whose set of base 10 digits is {1,4}.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(1)=1, a(2)=4; a(n) = 10*a(floor(n/2))+1 for n odd, otherwise a(n) = 10*a(floor((n-1)/2))+4. - _Bruno Berselli_, May 28 2012
program: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..15000] | Set(IntegerToSequence(n, 10)) subset {1, 4}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, May 28 2012
(Maxima) a[1]:1$ a[2]:4$ a[n]:= if oddp(n) then 10*a[floor(n/2)]+1 else 10*a[floor((n-1)/2)]+4$ makelist(a[n],n,1,40); - _Bruno Berselli_, May 28 2012
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 45)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, May 13 2021
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
